zh.title: 美元/日元技术分析：[上涨趋势保持，关注关键支撑位]
zh.content:
当前美元/日元（USD/JPY）在155.56500附近交易，整体保持上涨趋势。过去24小时内，价格小幅波动，仅有0.08%的变化，显示出市场的稳定性。高点155.60001和低点155.42400的形成意味着短期内价格在此区间内震荡，若能突破155.60001，可能进一步向上测试更高的阻力位。

技术指标方面，虽然RSI(14)数据缺失，但当前的MACD值为0.1134，表明市场仍然处于强势区域。20日简单移动平均线（SMA）在155.23030，作为重要支撑位，若价格回调至此水平，则可能吸引买盘介入。投资者应密切关注这些指标，以判断进一步的趋势方向。

在支撑和阻力位方面，当前的支撑位位于155.23030，若价格跌破此水平，则可能会引发更多的卖盘压力。阻力位则在155.60001，突破此位将为进一步上涨打开空间。在此背景下，建议短期内在支撑位附近寻找买入机会，并在接近阻力位时设定止盈策略，保持灵活应对市场变化。

en.title: US Dollar vs Japanese Yen Technical Analysis
en.content:
The USD/JPY pair is currently trading at 155.565, reflecting a slight increase of 0.08% over the past 24 hours. The price has fluctuated within a range of 155.60001 and 155.42400, indicating a consolidation phase. This range suggests that market participants are weighing their positions amid mixed sentiment regarding future monetary policy decisions from both the Federal Reserve and the Bank of Japan. The prevailing trend remains bullish, supported by the broader strength of the US dollar against a backdrop of rising interest rates.

The absence of the RSI(14) value limits our ability to assess overbought or oversold conditions accurately. However, the MACD reading of 0.11344175 indicates a positive momentum trend, potentially signaling further upside if the momentum continues. The 20-period Simple Moving Average (SMA) stands at 155.23030, acting as a dynamic support level. A price close above this SMA would reinforce the bullish trend, while a break below may suggest a shift in sentiment.

Key support levels to watch include the recent low of 155.42400, which, if breached, could lead to further selling pressure. Conversely, resistance is observed at 155.60001, a crucial level that, if broken, could open the door to higher targets in the short term. Traders should closely monitor these levels for potential breakout opportunities, as they will likely dictate the next moves in this currency pair.

Given the current bullish sentiment and solid technical indicators, a prudent trading strategy would involve looking for buying opportunities near the SMA support level. A stop-loss could be placed just below the support at 155.42400 to mitigate potential losses. Conversely, if the price breaks above the resistance at 155.60001, traders might consider increasing their long positions, targeting higher levels while maintaining a disciplined risk management approach.
